wikipedia_page.main: Philip Edwards (3 September 1949 – 24 April 2017) was a British professional road racing cyclist.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1972 Summer Olympics
Cycling at the 1972 Summer Olympics – Men's individual road race

response: After finishing third in third in the Star Trophy Series on 1970 and 1971, he finally won the Star Trophy in 1972 which led to him being selected for the 1972 Summer Olympics in Munich, West Germany. After being part of an 80-mile breakaway, he initially finished 5th in the road race, ahead of teammate Phil Edwards won the bunch sprint to finish 6th. However, after Spanish rider Jaime Huelamo failed a drug test, he was later moved up to 4th.
Philip or Phil Edwards may refer to:
* Phil Edwards (cyclist) (1949–2017), British road racing cyclist
* Phil Edwards (runner) (1907–1971), Canadian and Guyanese track and field athlete
